revised_title: Vibrationally Excited Molecules and Their Reactions: The Case of Methylene and Isobutene
tldr: The author investigates the reaction of methylene with isobutene when the methylene is in a vibrationally excited state. They find that the methylene can have excess energy, which leads to different reactions. The results show that the excited methylene reacts with isobutene to form 1,1-dimethylcyclopropane, which can isomerize into other products. The study provides insights into the reactivity of methylene and the role of energy in chemical reactions.
